summary: Tucson is the second-largest city in Arizona, located in Pima County. With a population of over 540,000, it's home to the University of Arizona and part of the larger Tucson-Nogales area. Founded as a Spanish military fort in 1775, Tucson became part of the U.S. in 1853. It was Arizona's capital from 1867 to 1877 and is known for its dark, basalt-covered hills, earning the name "Old Pueblo." Today, Tucson is famous for its optical science and telescopes, and was the first U.S. city named a "City of Gastronomy" by UNESCO.
title: Tucson, Arizona
